titleStmt.title: The hasty bride-groom: or, The rarest sport that hath of late been tri'd, between a lusty bride-grome and his bride. To the tune of, Bass his carreer: or. Bow bells.
titleStmt.author: Hesselwood, Henry.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Francis Grove dwelling on Snow-hill,

notesStmt.note: Author and date of publication from Wing.
Verse: "Come from [the] temple away to the bed ..."
In two parts, printed side by side.
At head of second part: The second part, to the same tune.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
